TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Hype Train's Back in the Station" Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_n9511c6vE61rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><em>Editor’s Note: Portions of the staff have been in and out of meetings all day, so some have not been so easy to catch for comment. We’ll try to update this post with their thoughts throughout the week, if possible.</em></p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-d2cfb29f-6080-0edd-2023-bccc86264134"><span>Alex (aLeXmOrA): </span></strong>Well, last week was release week and I have to say it was a little stressful one for me. I had everything set and ready in the KSP website to make a smooth and clear release, but you should always keep in mind that MurphyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s law will get you anyway. So, as expected, there were some issues with the downloads and then the KSP Forums. In the end, after a few hours, I managed to fix the issues and left everything up and running for the weekend, so all of you could get the First Contract update. I really hope youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re enjoying it!</p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-d2cfb29f-6080-3e6f-74a5-2599dcce7f17"><span>Daniel (danRosas)</span><span>: </span></strong>Wrapping up the release, really cool to see the response from you guys, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re an amazing community. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve made some wallpapers that are being released, for First Contract fans. There are some tasks floating around at hand, there are some models that have been done that need to be taken into the game, and I just had an interesting chat with HarvestR about them. Also, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working on a new animatic, but IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m still not happy with how the events inside the short are unfolding, so IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m going through that other stuff in order to have a clearer mind about the Kebal misfortunes <strong id="docs-internal-guid-d2cfb29f-6080-3e6f-74a5-2599dcce7f17"><span> </span></strong></p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-d2cfb29f-6080-75a1-4e90-ce4800372fa3"><span>Jim (Romfarer)</span><span>: </span></strong>This is by far the biggest gui update IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve worked on and it feels great that itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s finally released, even though we discovered a bit of a game stopping bug for the moddable features of the application launcher. But fear not, this bug only affects mods and it is possible to circumvent the bug. In any case the bug has been fixed and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s already in the pipeline for the next version. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m also likely to throw in some extra features that were suggested too late in the process to include with 0.24.</p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-d2cfb29f-6081-21c6-a9e7-aa982afaf78c"><span>Bob (Calisker):</span></strong> It was a lot of fun to get the update out the door - thank you to all of our friends in the games media who covered the announcement. We spent a lot of time drafting the press release, making sure it was factual and really explained why First Contract is such a great update for KSP. One story IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m particularly interested in is those of you who are playing with your children. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d be willing to share your story about why you choose to play KSP with your kids (or if youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re playing with one of your parents, let me know too). Please email <a href="mailto:[email protected]">[email protected]</a> with the subject line: Generational Play in KSP. Thanks! .<strong id="docs-internal-guid-d2cfb29f-6081-21c6-a9e7-aa982afaf78c"><span><br/></span></strong></p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-d2cfb29f-6081-5bd7-0955-0b879ed1c1bd"><span>Anthony (Rowsdower):</span></strong> Another update’s been put in the books. We’re glad to see First Contract was worth the wait for many of you. I can’t wait to see where the hype train goes for 0.25. Anyway, I’d just like to publicly thank the mods on the forum and reddit for keeping the train on rails, especially on the forum. The number 502 will forever haunt everyone. The media and KSP-TV crew also deserve major props for simply doing what they do best and entertaining you all. Ok, now that that’s all been said, it’s back to business.</p>

<p><strong>Rogelio (Roger):</strong><span> Hey guys, hope you like the first contract video IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve started to work on new models for the next animatic, but until the whole team feel happy with the .idea weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll tell you more about it.</span></p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-d2cfb29f-60b0-80f5-cc16-3bd752865e15"><br/><span>Hugo (The Intern): </span><span>.</span></strong>Had a lot of fun with the new release!! Still working on some pieces aesthetics. Mainly working on the MK line right now. Hopefully you guys will like the work. Had a very interesting and insightful conversation with Felipe and Dan to discuss some designs and what we would envision to add in the future.</p>

First!

also new MK pods overhaul. VERY EXCITE
having fun with 0.24.
Huh, I would have expected the devnotes to all be along the lines of "Couldn't find the team member, because they were sleeping".

Only the update could've ever stopped the hype train.

I've really been enjoying 0.24 so far. Thanks for eating up so much of my time with it.

Really enjoying the new update!

IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m also likely to throw in some extra features that were suggested too late in the process to include with 0.24.
there are some models that have been done that need to be taken into the game, and I just had an interesting chat with HarvestR about them.

Oh. Mah. Dayum.

Wow 5 comments and nobody's complained that the devnotes don't say that each dev worked a 90 hour week preparing for 0.25. I'm proud of the forum. Proud, I say.

Congrats on the release. Loved the vid and I'm having lots of fun with the contracts.

Now SLEEP. We expect double work next week!
you guys deserve a little break for this and so does the hype train. so good work you guys, but don't you guys worry the hype train is always ready to leave station

Thank you guys for the hard work and 64-bit release, no more memory issues!

Just few crashes but I`ll take it!

Romfarer, any chance of this GUI bug being fixed for the next version? It affects every window in the space center scene, stock or modded, and makes mods that work primarily in the Space Center scene difficult to use. The only way I found around it is to enable the KSC_FACILITIES lock, which also for some reason pauses time.

Also I feel like a jerk. Sorry for not initially saying THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR HARD WORK GUYS! Now take a break for a few days/weeks while the modders get to work with their magic

I love the KSP dev team. I mean, HarvesteR is a great leader and all around great guy, Romfarer is a wiz when it comes to designing GUIs, Mu lays out a lot of the groundwork in KSP and contributes a lot, danRosas is a god at creating animations, Rowsdower is a great kommunity manager, Rogelio and Hugo are doing great work given that they're interns, aLeX is great with servers, and Bob is an all-around great guy. Sorry if I forgot any names! Of course, C7 was great as well but he left now.

Great job everyone!

Edited July 23, 2014 by Woopert

Wrapping up the release, really cool to see the response from you guys, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re an amazing community. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve made some wallpapers that are being released, for First Contract fans.

wait new wallpapers, Where?

wait new wallpapers, Where?

Right HERE, Helix. Well, one of them.

Thank you for the update guys! Keep up the good work!

However, I'd like to hear more about your plans on x64 and its (re)discovered bugs. Is they Unity- or KSP-related (or both)?

Sadly I missed the release, and I won't be able to play ksp, an .24 for a while. Might not get to util .25. Computers hard drive is failing. from the sounds of things though .24 seems to be an amazin update, and all the devs deserve some breaks. Looking forward to what you guys come up with next!

Very Fun update! 64-bit is truly still in an alpha state. We hope to see a bug fix release for it if there are issues that can be addressed on your side. If not, we'll just patiently wait until Unity gets its act together.
Very fun update indeed. Sadly I have to stick with 32-bit because 64-bit is way too buggy for me but hopefully it gets sorted out.
Where is Jesus? Any multiplayer updates?

Presenting, the Hype Train, refuelling for it's next journey!

Also, thanks for recognising the mods! Yah!

Aw. I was hoping to get some kind of info on what's coming in .25.

Also, you should know that you are doing an AWESOME job at, well, everything related to KSP. THANK YOU!
Very much enjoying 0.24. Thank you.

Thanks for the beautiful game so far, I'm very glad you guys keep going.

I've put more hours into KSP than any other game I own on Steam... more than even my Steam account shows (which is over 600).. probably over 1000. I only bought it just around 0.18 I believe, but man, I love this game and all you've done to it! KEep yp the AMAZING work!

IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m also likely to throw in some extra features that were suggested too late in the process to include with 0.24.

Please, please tell me that we will be able to set each part's recovery value individually

Alex (aLeXmOrA): ... So, as expected, there were some issues with the downloads and then the KSP Forums.

Might I suggest doing "soft" launches in the future? Put the stuff online, but don't tell anyone. Some people will find it anyway, and it will slowly spread by word of mouth. All the while you monitor things. Then later, you formally announce it.
Is Squad planning any hot fixes for 0.24?
